request_pathways.name: Patient Authorization to Disclose, Release, and/or Obtain Protected Health Information
Postal mail to Enterprise Records and Health Information

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patients use a single generic HIPAA authorization form for all release purposes, with a 'Personal' checkbox indicating self-access; MyChart is promoted for recent records.

bright_spots: MyChart fast-track prominently promoted at top of form for immediate record download
Five delivery format options (CD/DVD, Paper, MyChart, USB, Email)
Three submission channels (mail, fax, email) with complete contact information
Full page of item-by-item completion instructions
Multi-facility coverage with single form across all UW Medicine entities

findability.rationale: Level 4: Easy to find via web search and website navigation; the patient forms page links directly to the working URL, though the uwmedicine.org CDN blocks some alternate URLs.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 4: Fully fillable 61-field interactive PDF that can be submitted electronically via email or fax; one gap is that the workflow requires saving the filled PDF and attaching it to an email rather than integrated online submission.

content_design.rationale: Level 4: Well-organized numbered sections with logical flow and a dedicated instruction page; minor clarity issues in the dense legal paragraph about conditioning treatment on authorization.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 4: Patient access is clearly accommodated via the 'Personal' purpose checkbox, MyChart fast-track promotion, and five delivery formats, even though the form serves multiple purposes and doesn't distinguish patient rights from third-party authorization.

compliance.rationale: Level 4: No unnecessary barriers, clear patient rights statement, no notarization requirement, and generous 3-year expiration; minor ambiguity around blanket sensitive information release language and no fee disclosure.

overall.summary: UW Medical Center provides a well-designed, fillable generic authorization form with strong digital capabilities, multiple submission channels, and an exemplary MyChart fast-track, but lacks a dedicated patient access pathway distinct from third-party release.
